text: uh
hi everyone destiny met tano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of this new danger
mouse and black thought project cheat
codes this is a new collab between two
absolute legends spitter extraordinaire
philly's own black thought of the roots
fame who is teaming up with
groundbreaking and game-changing
producer danger mouse his collaborations
over the years have proven to be some of
the most significant in popular music
gorillas demon days danger doom gnarls
barkley also a dark knight of the soul
with sparkle horse and cheat codes here
shaping up to be yet another as black
thought brings it lyrically on pretty
much every project he's involved with
whether that be a roots record or some
of the solo stuff he's been sculpting
lately and of course hearing danger
mouse back in a hip hop production mode
is going to be exciting and believe me
when i say this project does not
disappoint cause black thought and
danger mouse both respectively put
forward their best foot and the artistic
chemistry between these two just make
them a match made in heaven not to
mention there's some strategically
placed and carefully chosen features
across this project too the production
as well is classy and classic without
sounding dated textured and lo-fi
without sacrificing too much fidelity or
color it's groovy it's varied and
tasteful too like on the very dramatic
and cinematic opener sometimes where
black thought launches into a single
verse among all of these grand and weepy
soulful hits of strings and vocals some
lines even read like a really intense
self-portrait there's also a pretty
murderous beat on the title track with
chunky kicks and toms as well as these
beautiful descending horn lines a total
and utter banger if there ever was one
then the production on the darkest part
is more of a boom bap standard with some
sweet piano chops though i think on the
whole it's a little bit hollow due to a
lack of a strong bass line even black
thoughts voice on this track sounds a
bit too monotone and in the distance
which is a shame because there are some
standout bars from him and raquan on
this cut too it's really the super
expressive vocal harmonies on the hook
that end up stealing the show oddly
enough no gold teeth by comparison is
not nearly as hooky but there is a bit
more beef to it sonically with its fat
bassy rhythms some elements of the drums
that feel very loose and lo-fi as well
meanwhile black thought's voice feels
like it was recorded on an iphone
speaker or something like that either
way
how it's presented is raw as hell which
shows up not just in his voice but his
lyricism too saying his flow is so obese
it's springing a slow leak from front to
back on the track he just does not let
up meanwhile because is another standout
not just because of the luxurious soul
samples on the guitars and drums but the
youthful lead vocals from dillon
cartilage on the hook are a wonderful
touch too there are impressive verses on
this track not only just from black
thought but joey badass and also russ
yes like everyone's favorite rapper hey
russ we essentially get three stunners
here with black thought going in about
cycles of poverty violence with some
haunting imagery in the mix joey packs a
similar energy into his verse talking
about brushes with violence in his youth
and being surveilled by the police and
the paranoia that that brings meanwhile
russ is rapping on this track about his
very hot-headed ways which the internet
has had a field day with on multiple
occasions which he goes into with a lot
of heart and some honest dissection the
haunting be on the track belize is a
treat the murky bass shimmering keys and
kind of mournful horns make for the
perfect foundation for a great and
posthumous verse from the one and only
mf doom which is laced with some classic
self-referential bars though part of me
does wonder if this verse was left from
that danger doom era as there are
references in the bars to danger as well
as brood witch which is a pretty classic
aqua teen hunger force episode which may
make it feel a little out of place on
this project but still at the end of the
day because it's landing in that
particular era of doom's career you know
the writing and delivery is high quality
the cut aquamarine with michael kuwanuka
is grand and beautiful cinematic just
like the intro cut the dusty and droning
strings and keys on this track sound
like a hero out of a spaghetti western
coming back for vengeance against the
outlaws that took over his town mike
subtly sung bars about everything
burning down closing his eyes and
enemies being all around just kind of
enhance that experience then black
thoughts bars here really met the moment
in terms of addressing things like
evolution the human condition
spirituality we also have the short and
contemplative identical deaths which is
okay it breezes by a bit but moving on
from here the last leg of this project
has some bops too strangers the groove
on this track is honestly to my ears
indescribable we get these muddy tones
stuttering flawlessly across these
massive drums oppressively thick and
loud bass the whole thing rolls so
fluidly it doesn't even feel like a loop
it's hypnotic as [ __ ] now snobs will
probably look at asap rocky here nestled
in between black thought lp and killer
mike on this cut and think what the hell
is he doing here but in fact rocky does
hold his own without even breaking a
sweat with some cool flow switch-ups and
hilarious references to dr seuss and
broken iphones the surrounding verses
feature a lot of bark bark bark bark but
it's really killer mike who i think
comes through the most cold-blooded
going as far as to say he'll pop you
with the same
pistol they shot reagan with then
there's close to famous which i think is
honestly a candidate for the worst beat
on this project what is this i get that
aesthetically it does feel in line with
everything else here in terms of the
tone and timbre of the bass the
percussion but the finer details of this
track are horrid there is this very bong
bong bass line whose groove is just
nowhere to be found we also have some
pitchy wheezing
organ cords just two really that are
holding on for dear life the drums
barely sync up with everything on top of
them and what sounds like a very deep
synthetic kick is completely mismatched
with the ram shackle hi-hat and snare
the vibes are rancid the vibes are
rancid thankfully the great conway the
machine is a treat on the song saltwater
which is soundtracked by the kind of
eerie boombat beat that's great for
griselda verse blackthought brings some
heady bars about depicting uh younger
rappers relishing street life and fast
money and that ultimately being their
undoing though he doesn't paint this
commentary as an attempt on his part to
reach out or illustrate a point because
he says on this verse that you can't
[ __ ] a bullshitter which i think is
a pretty grim statement on uh the
futility of uh trying to do anything or
say anything of significance with your
music not to say that you shouldn't try
but you know again it's a pretty dark
outlook meanwhile conway's grim bars
skip rope across the beat making
references to shootings traps drugs late
hours uh it's it's kind of standard for
griselda
but you get what you pay for i think
there's a pretty strong closer on this
lp2 there's a grand sense of finality in
black thoughts verse i can't say these
tracks came together in a super holistic
way as i kind of digest them and look
back on them but regardless the vast
majority of the cuts on this thing are
very good i think black thought and
danger mouse here just made some killer
cuts assembled them into a tight track
list and given how high the baseline of
talent these two are typically working
with is i don't know if we needed much
more than that from them i'm feeling a
light to decent eight on this record
tran position have you given this album
a listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well over here next to my head
it's another video that you can check
out hit that up or the link to subscribe
to the channel anthony fantano black
thought danger mouse of forever
